components.content: Provide the details as they appear on your passport.

components.hint: If you have a middle name on your passport you must include it here

components.name: occupation

components.hint: If you have more than one occupation, please state your main one. Retired and unemployed are both accepted answers

pages.title: What is your current marital status?

components.name: currentStatus
components.title: What is your current marital status?

components.content: ! Warning If you have a Thai address you will have to provide your yellow book (Tabien Baan) that proves your residency. Your partner's blue book can't be used as your proof of address.
We may need to contact you about your application.

components.name: partnerName
components.title: Full name
components.hint: As shown on passport or Thai ID

components.name: partnersPassportNumber
components.title: Passport/Thai ID number
components.hint: This will be the passport or Thai ID you will need to bring to the embassy

components.content: If your father is deceased you still need to provide his details.

components.name: fathersName
components.title: Full name
components.hint: Name should match the UK long birth certificate. If you don't know your father's name, leave it blank.

components.content: If your mother is deceased you still need to provide her details.

components.name: mothersName
components.title: Full name
components.hint: Name should match the UK long birth certificate. If you don't know your mother's name, leave it blank.

components.content: Add a photo of your partner's passport – the page with the passport photo – or their Thai ID

We welcome your views on the registration service.

If you agree to be contacted by answering 'yes' below, you will be consenting to share your personal data – name, email address, telephone number and service received – with our independent partner research agency, IFF research.

You may withdraw your consent at any stage by email consular.research@fco.gov.uk.

For more details on how your data will be handled in relation to feedback please see the research privacy policy at www.gov.uk/fco/tell-fco.

components.name: contactForFeedback
components.title: Can our partner contact you for feedback to help improve the service?

pages.title: What type of ceremony are you planning?

components.name: ceremony
components.title: What type of ceremony are you planning?

components.content:
To get married in Thailand you need to:

  • complete your affirmation of marital status online
  • swear an affirmation at the embassy in Bangkok

After you've sworn your affirmation you have until the end of the calendar month plus 3 months to get married or your documents will become invalid.

If your partner is British they will also need to swear an affirmation. If they're not, they might need an equivalent document.

Complete your affirmation of marital status

You can either complete your affirmation of marital status online or download and complete the paper application.

This service costs £50. You can pay by card online. If you're completing the paper application, you can pay cash or card at the embassy.

pages.title: How to complete your affirmation of marital status
Is your partner of the opposite sex?

components.name: partnerOfOppositeSex
components.title: Is your partner of the opposite sex?

components.content: Upload the following documents:

You can either scan your documents or take photos on your mobile phone.

You may find it easier to take photos on your phone and then send them to the device you're using for your application.

components.title: How to take a good photograph
components.content:
• lay it flat on a table or for better results against a wall
  • make sure all information is readable
  • no flash if possible
  • position the phone parallel to the document
  • use both hands to keep your phone steady

Have the following information ready:

  • province and date of marriage registration at the district office
  • name and address of two referees

Who can be a referee?

Your referees must not live in Thailand.

They don't have to be the same as the witness to your marriage.
Add a photo of the main page of your UK passport - the page with the passport photo.
Provide details as they appear on your decree absolute.

components.name: decreeAbsolutePlaceOfIssue
components.title: Place of issue
components.hint: If you were divorced in the UK write the place of issue exactly as it appears on your decree absolute, for example IN THE Derby County Court

pages.title: Place and date of your marriage registration

components.content: ! Warning The Thai authorities require the name of the province you're getting married in, not the city or town.

components.name: marriageDate
components.title: Date
components.hint: The date cannot be more than 3 months in advance

components.content:
Your referees must not live in Thailand.

They don't have to be the same as the witnesses to your marriage.

Your referees must not live in Thailand.

They don't have to be the same as the witnesses to your marriage.
